citeinfo.title: Radiometric Data of Airborne Geophysical Surveys over the 2011 Mineral, Virginia, Earthquake Area
Airborne Geophysical Surveys over the 2011 Mineral, Virginia, Earthquake Area

descript.abstract: The 2011 moment magnitude (Mw) 5.8 central Virginia earthquake was felt by millions of people and caused significant damage in the eastern United States. As part of efforts to better understand the faults and geologic features associated with the earthquake, the U.S. Geological Survey commissioned airborne geophysical surveys over the epicentral area. The surveys were conducted from July 15, 2012 - July 25, 2012, by Sander Geophysics Limited. The area was flown along a draped surface with a nominal survey height above ground of 125 meters. The flight line spacing was 200 meters for traverse lines and 2000 meters for control lines. Here we present downloadable radiometric data from those surveys as image (GeoTiff or kmz), grid (gxf) or flight line (csv) data.
descript.purpose: Dissemination of airborne geophysical survey data collected near the 2011 moment magnitude 5.8 Mineral, Virginia (Louisa County) earthquake and summary of research results.

attracc.attraccr: Radiometric data consistency checks, calibrations and corrections include adjustments for aircraft accelerations, flying height, heading, pitch, roll, yaw, lag , altitude attenuation, cosmic and aircraft background radiation, background radon, dead time and system noise. Determination of stripping ratios, attenuation coefficients and sensitivity were conducted prior to the survey (using the survey aircraft configuration) using Geological Society of Canada facilities. Control lines were used to level the dataset. Details of data processing can be found in the Survey Technical Report by Sander Geophysics Limited at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/53f5a9c9e4b09d12e0e86438

dataqual.logic: Tests for logical consistency between data attributes were performed where appropriate. Final data were also compared to previous regional datasets to check for consistency. Details of data processing can be found in the Survey Technical Report by Sander Geophysics Limited at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/53f5a9c9e4b09d12e0e86438

horizpa.horizpar: Position and terrain clearance of the aircraft were determined by combining DGPS (differential global positioning system), radar, barometric, and laser altimetry measurements. Test flights over a known area were used for instrument calibration. Details can be found in the Survey Technical Report by Sander Geophysics Limited at https://www.sciencebase.gov/catalog/item/53f5a9c9e4b09d12e0e86438

overview.eaover: Radiometric methods use gamma ray spectrometry to estimate relative amounts of potassium (K), uranium (U), and thorium (Th) in the upper 0.5-1 meter of Earth's crust. Radiometric data includes the image (GeoTiff or kmz), grid (gxf) or flight line (csv) data.
